article_title: John McCain gets a little excited about a home run
article_text:
Sen. John McCain (R-Ariz.) went to the Arizona Diamondbacks game Saturday night, and let’s just say he got a little excited when Paul Goldschmidt hit his first of two home runs of the night.

So excited that he hugged the air while screaming.

Politicians have feelings, too.

The Diamondbacks had already held the lead over the Los Angeles Dodgers when this happened, making it that much more priceless. The game ended with the Diamondbacks leading 18-7 and one happy old man.

Now if only that excitement can be brought to Washington.

h/t MLB.com

Sen. John McCain (R-Ariz.) went to the Arizona Diamondbacks game Saturday night, and let’s just say he got a little excited when Paul Goldschmidt hit his first of two home runs of the night.
The Diamondbacks had already held the lead over the Los Angeles Dodgers when this happened, making it that much more priceless.
So excited that he hugged the air while screaming.
The game ended with the Diamondbacks leading 18-7 and one happy old man.
Now if only that excitement can be brought to Washington.
